item.title: The “Retail Leek” Psychology in Futures Trading
item.author: contact@yfreetime.com (Danny Yuan)
item.description: At first I thought futures trading was just a toy for a small group of high‑risk crypto players, while spot was the “mainstream.” After getting involved, I realized I was wrong. In crypto, spot volume is far smaller than futures—futures are the real main force (though most people still trade spot). This “fast lane” lets you feel market turbulence every second. You don’t need to own the asset; you just predict price movements and speculate on the spread. I learned the hard way that in this market, the strongest capital often decides the direction.

item.title: Futures Trading vs. Gambling: Prediction Markets and Traditional Finance Compared
item.author: contact@yfreetime.com (Danny Yuan)
item.description: Recently, while studying crypto derivatives, I noticed many people ask: Is futures trading basically gambling? It’s a good question. Futures trading is about predicting price movements, while gambling is betting on uncertain outcomes. They sound similar, but the logic is different. I also encountered prediction markets like Polymarket, which feel related.
